description: The New York Times would like to hear from Chicago residents about their experiences living in the city under the mayorship of Rahm Emanuel.
title: What Is Chicago Like Under Mayor Rahm Emanuel?
title_page: What Is Chicago Like Under Mayor Rahm Emanuel? - The New York Times
maintext:
Rahm Emanuel, who was easily elected mayor of Chicago in 2011, was dealt a setback on Tuesday when he failed to win a second term and was forced into a runoff election this spring.
During his first term, Mr. Emanuel won praise from many residents for requiring a longer day in city schools, raising the minimum wage and improving the train system. Yet he clashed with the Chicago Teachers Union and oversaw the closing of nearly 50 public schools.
New York Times reporters covering the Chicago mayoral race would like to hear from Chicago residents about their experiences living in the city during Mr. Emanuelâ€™s tenure. Your comments may be published, but your contact information will not. A reporter or editor may follow up with you to learn more about your story.
